Class Chest

java.lang.Object
com.university.elements.boxes.Chest
All Implemented Interfaces:
IBox, IEventListener
public class Chest extends Object implements IBox, IEventListener
Represents a chest in the game that contains a random item The chest can be opened by the player, and once opened, the item is added to the current room's inventory

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Chest()
    Constructs a new Chest with a default description and a random item inside The chest is initially closed

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    boolean
    isOpened()
    Checks whether the chest has been opened
    void
    onEvent(IEvent event)
     
    void
    open(GameContext gameContext, IEffect effect)
    Opens the chest if it hasn't been opened yet If the chest is already opened, it notifies the player Upon opening, the item inside the chest is added to the current room's inventory

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Chest

      public Chest()
      Constructs a new Chest with a default description and a random item inside The chest is initially closed

  • Method Details

    • open

      public void open(GameContext gameContext, IEffect effect)
      Opens the chest if it hasn't been opened yet If the chest is already opened, it notifies the player Upon opening, the item inside the chest is added to the current room's inventory
      Specified by:
      open in interface IBox
      Parameters:
      gameContext - The current game context, providing information about the player and the room

    • isOpened

      public boolean isOpened()
      Checks whether the chest has been opened
      Specified by:
      isOpened in interface IBox
      Returns:
      true if the chest has been opened, false otherwise
